questiontext.text:
Find the equation of the quartic shown in the graph:

[[jsxgraph width='250px' height='250px']] JXG.Options.axis.ticks.majorHeight = 10; JXG.Options.axis.ticks.insertTicks = false; JXG.Options.axis.ticks.ticksDistance = 200; JXG.Options.text.fontSize = 16; var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, {boundingbox: {#BB#}, axis: true, showCopyright: false, showNavigation:false}); var f = board.jc.snippet('{#q#}', true, 'x', true); board.create('functiongraph', [f,{#BB[1]#},{#BB[3]#}],{strokeColor:'#003399',strokeWidth:2}); var xaxis = board.create('axis', [[0,0],[1,0]]); board.create('ticks', [xaxis, {#[a1,b1]#}], {strokeColor: '#003399', majorHeight:15, drawLabels: true, label: { offset: [0, -10],anchorX: 'middle', anchorY: 'top' }}); var yaxis = board.create('axis', [[0,0],[0,1]]); board.create('ticks', [yaxis, {#[y0]#}], {strokeColor: '#003399', majorHeight:15, drawLabels: true, label: { offset: [-10, 0],anchorX: 'right', anchorY: 'middle' }}); [[/jsxgraph]]

\(y=\) [[input:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
The graph cuts the \(x\)-axis at \(x={@b1@}\) so the factorised form of the quartic will have a single factor of \(({@x-b1@})\).

The graph has a root which is a point of inflection at \(x={@a1@}\) so there will also be a factor of \({@(x-a1)^3@}\).

So the quartic has the form \(y={@qform_withabc@}\) for some value of \(k\).

Since the quartic graph passes through the point \((0,{@y0@})\), we have

\[ {@y0@}={@(ev(qform_withabc,[x=0])),simp=false@}={@keqn@} \]

Thus \(k={@k1@}\).

Therefore the graph has equation \(y={@(ev(qform_withabc,[k=k1])),simp=false@}\).
